title: Gunshots at Brown University, Then 12 Hours of Lockdown and Fear
summary: Students sheltered in place in classrooms and basements, waiting for the all clear.

title: A Massacre in Australia, and Rob Reiner Is Found Dead in ‘Apparent Homicide’
summary: Plus, the hunt for the gunman in a shooting at Brown University.

title: Rob Reiner, Actor Who Went on to Direct Classic Films, Dies at 78
summary: Mr. Reiner, who was in “All in the Family,” directed films including “This Is Spinal Tap,” “When Harry Met Sally …,” “The Princess Bride” and “A Few Good Men.”

title: Michele Singer Reiner: A Photographer Who Changed Movie History
summary: Falling in love with her inspired the director Rob Reiner to give “When Harry Met Sally…” a new ending. The Reiners went on to work together on movies and political causes.

title: What We Know About Rob Reiner and His Death
summary: The director’s family said that he and his wife, Michele, had died on Sunday. The police said they had found two bodies at the Reiner home in Los Angeles.

title: How the Bondi Beach Shooting Unfolded
summary: Two men toting long guns opened fire on hundreds of people who were celebrating Hanukkah on Bondi Beach in Sydney, the core of the Australian city’s Jewish community.

title: What We Know About the Bondi Beach Shooting in Australia
summary: Two gunmen opened fire at dozens of people who were at a Jewish holiday event. At least 15 people were killed in the attack, and so was one of the shooters, the police said.

title: Trump’s Cuts Hobbled US Labor Board, Leaving Festering Disputes and a Power Struggle
summary: Advocates fear damage to labor protections if the Supreme Court upholds the president’s move to control federal agency staffing.

title: Trump’s Diversity Rollback Ends Crucial Aid for Deafblind Children Like Annie Garner
summary: A program for deafblind children helped 3-year-old Annie Garner, born with poor vision and no ears, learn to communicate. The Trump administration cut the program’s funding over diversity goals.

title: California Hires Former C.D.C. Officials Who Criticized Trump Administration
summary: A former director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and a former chief medical officer of the agency will advise the state on public health issues.

title: Trial to Start for Judge Accused of Helping Undocumented Immigrant Evade Agents
summary: The Milwaukee County judge faces federal charges, but she has maintained her innocence.

title: With Prices Soaring, Can New York Survive as a Mecca for the Arts?
summary: The number of artists living in the city has declined after growing sharply between 2004 and 2019. Almost 50 arts venues have closed in the past five years.

title: The Turbulent Times of Friedrich Merz
summary: The new chancellor believes the world needs a stronger Germany. He is still navigating how to do it.

title: Zelensky Meets U.S. Envoys in Berlin in New Round of Ukraine Peace Talks
summary: For the second day running, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine was set to meet in Berlin with Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, two key Trump aides.

title: Jimmy Lai Faces Up to Life in a Hong Kong Jail After Guilty Verdicts
summary: Jimmy Lai, the publisher of a Hong Kong tabloid, was convicted of national security charges on Monday after spending decades supporting the city’s now vanquished pro-democracy movement.

title: Jimmy Lai’s Life, in Photos and Video
summary: He attributed his rags-to-riches ascent to the freedoms of Hong Kong, and has paid a hefty price for defending them.

title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement
summary: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.

title: Olivia Dean, Josh Johnson and Chase Infiniti Are Among Our 2025 Breakout Stars
summary: Across the arts, these 10 performers took a leap of faith this year and stuck the landing in a big way.

title: A Powerful New Drug Is Creating a ‘Withdrawal Crisis’ in Philadelphia
summary: Medetomidine, a veterinary sedative, mixed into fentanyl has sent thousands to hospitals, not only for overdose but for life-threatening withdrawal. It is spreading to other cities.

title: Trump’s Diplomats Act More Like Cowboys. Could That Be a Good Thing?
summary: Sometimes Trump’s unconventional foreign policy just works.

title: U.S. Military Plane and JetBlue Flight Nearly Collided Over Caribbean, Radio Traffic Shows
summary: The Air Force refueling tanker was flying without its location transponder activated and could not be detected by air traffic control.

title: China Approaches First Investment Decline in 3 Decades
summary: A broad measure of investment fell more than 10 percent in November, continuing a recent reversal and signaling the depth of China’s property crisis.

title: New York City Gets Its First Big Snowfall of the Season
summary: The city has not seen this much snow this early in the season since 2018, the National Weather Service said.

title: Jeanette Winter, Who Told Children About Artists’ Lives, Dies at 86
summary: Her picture books found models of perseverance and imagination in figures like Emily Dickinson, Georgia O’Keeffe and Benny Goodman.
